page.title: 18PITFOUR ESTATE
page.content: Part of the former Pitfour Estate lies in our block, although the site of the mansion house and the lake outside the block's southern border. There are several existing features, however, which are of interest. One of the most interesting of all is that of a Recumbent Stone Circle which lies in the south western area of the block, Drinnie's Wood. The stones are set on a bank surrounded by vast pine trees. The west flanker, recumbent and two other stones are in place, three having fallen. The recumbent is ten and a quarter feet long, four feet high and weighs approximately twelve tons. The recumbent is south_west of the circumference.
